title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Office of Environmental Education is established. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to include balanced and scientifically sound support, reorganize paragraphs, specify staff requirements, and outline activities for the Office of Environmental Education. The Administrator may carry out activities directly or through grants, agreements, or contracts. SEC. 3. ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION GRANTS amended to reduce funding for lobbying activities. SEC. 4. ENVIRONMENTAL INTERNSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS included in the National Environmental Education Act. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by striking sections 7 through 11 and redesignating them as sections 7 through 10. Conforming amendments are made to various sections and the table of contents. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by redesignating sections 7 through 11 as sections 7 through 10, with various conforming amendments made to different sections and the table of contents. This includes changes such as replacing references to specific sections with new section numbers. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to establish the President's Environmental Youth Awards for students in grades K-12 who excel in local environmental projects. Additionally, an Environmental Education Advisory Council and Task Force are created. Section 8 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to specify the composition of the Advisory Council and Task Force, including the sectors represented and the eligibility criteria for membership. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to allow representatives from any Federal agency engaged in environmental education to join the Task Force. The Advisory Council will now hold biennial meetings on environmental education issues and provide recommendations. The Advisory Council will now hold biennial meetings on environmental education issues and provide recommendations. Additionally, a National Environmental Education and Training Foundation is established. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name of the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and make conforming amendments to related sections. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to rename the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" in various sections. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name of the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" in different sections, including increasing the number of directors and removing certain conditions of donations. SEC. 8. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997-2007. Funds are allocated for various environmental education activities, including grants and the Foundation for Environmental Education. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations for environmental education activities, with funds allocated for grants and the Foundation for Environmental Education. 40% of the funds are designated for environmental education grants, 10% for the Foundation, and no more than 25% for administrative expenses. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of either October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of this Act.
